newsitem.title: USA: Lilly sees 1996 R&D costs up over 1995.
newsitem.headline: Lilly sees 1996 R&D costs up over 1995.

text.p: Eli Lilly and Co said it expects research and development expenses to increase about 12 to 14 percent for the year compared with 1995.
"This estimate could be affected by unanticipated changes in the timing of technology investments," the company said.
In the third quarter, R&D spending was $290.7 million, up from $260.6 million in the year-ago period.

The increase was "primarily due to expenses in support of clinical trials and development expenditures for products, such as raloxifene, that are in the later and most expensive phases of clinical research," Lilly said.
